question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is Indiana expected to hold a public vote on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana carries out a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For an affirmative conclusion, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The public vote must be formally declared and executed by the state of Indiana.
2. The main emphasis of the public vote must be on the protection of abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the public vote must be disclosed through official state communications or widely acknowledged news outlets.

If no such public vote that fulfills these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be resolved as negative. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a public vote without actually carrying it out by the specified deadline does not meet the criteria for an affirmative resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Pennsylvania conducts a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, and (b) Tennessee enacts new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
   2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Tennessee enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Union Pacific introduce a new freight train scheduling system by August 2024?

Confirmation of the implementation must come from official statements by the company or coverage by at least two credible news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new framework must be specifically aimed at improving the quality of life issues related to the predictability of freight train scheduling. If such a system is not implemented and verified by the resolution date, or if the system introduced does not specifically focus on the predictability of freight train schedules, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will a prominent cybersecurity firm have completely moved its headquarters to Austin, Texas?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, a prominent cybersecurity firm has entirely shifted its headquarters from its initial location to Austin, Texas. For the answer to be YES:

1. The company or its executives must make an official announcement regarding the relocation.
2. This announcement needs to be covered by at least two major, credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters in Austin, Texas must be operational, with essential executive functions established there.

Any partial relocations or ongoing plans as of July 31, 2024, will not qualify for a YES answer. If the relocation is not finalized and functioning by this date, or if the firm opts against the move, the response will be NO.

question.title: Will X's AI chatbot Grok be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that the AI chatbot Grok on the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Grok and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given Siri is reported for spreading election misinformation, will Tennessee hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?

Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Apple's Siri is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Siri and its role in spreading election misinformation.

Then, will Tennessee officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution by July 31, 2024? The referendum must be formally announced by the Tennessee state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Tennessee-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Tennessee and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Texas enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Texas enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not fall into a recession. For the context of this inquiry, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The inquiry will be deemed negative if the UK economy undergoes two successive quarters of declining GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Assuming the UK economy remains free from recession by July 2024, will General Motors' quarterly net profit rise by more than 20% compared to the same quarter the previous year by July 2024?

Let us consider the following scenario: The UK economy does not fall into a recession by July 31, 2024, which means it avoids experiencing two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as documented by the UK's Office for National Statistics from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024. 

In that case, can we confirm that General Motors will disclose a net profit increase exceeding 20% for any quarter when compared to the corresponding quarter from the previous year, in its official financial disclosures published by July 31, 2024? This increase must be substantiated through official earnings reports from the company or at least three reputable financial news outlets (for instance, Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Wall Street Journal). If there is no such increase reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

Confirmation of the implementation for both must come from official company announcements or be reported by a minimum of two credible news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or prominent national newspapers). The new scheduling system for train operators must focus specifically on improving schedule predictability for those in Texas, while the system for passenger train services must aim specifically at enhancing predictability for those services. question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

   - The interview to be conducted live on the X platform.
   - Elon Musk as the primary interviewer and Sergey Brin as the interviewee.
   - Official announcement by X or Elon Musk prior to the event.
   - Public accessibility of the interview on X.
   - Coverage by at least two major news outlets (e.g., CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press).

2. **Outcome (Q):** The United States implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles by August 31, 2024. This must be:
   - Officially confirmed by U.S. government announcements.
   - Reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times).
   - Specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China, not as part of a broader tariff.

question.title: Will Spotify announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Spotify officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 2% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Spotify only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 2% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given Spotify announces additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% by August 2024, will the Reserve Bank of India announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body:
This question considers two events: 

1. **Condition**: Will Spotify announce further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its workforce by August 31, 2024? To resolve as YES, Spotify must officially announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% by the specified date, confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. The additional layoffs must be separate from the initially reported reduction.

2. **Outcome**: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024? To resolve as YES, the Reserve Bank of India must publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate (repo rate) by the specified date, reported by at least two reputable financial news sources. The reduction must be concrete, not merely hinted or speculated.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy has not slipped into a recession. For this context, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of declining GDP as indicated by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. Conversely, the inquiry will be considered negative if the Italian economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

Then, will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) report a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024? This question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: Given that India's central bank's favored inflation metric indicates a monthly rise surpassing 0.5% by July 2024, will Uber terminate at least 1,800 jobs by that same date?

Assuming the following holds true: India's central bank's favored inflation metric reveals a month-over-month increase exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially disclosed by the Reserve Bank of India or an appropriate Indian governmental body and reported by a minimum of two credible financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times).

Then, is it accurate to state that Uber will cut at least 1,800 jobs by July 31, 2024, as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI? Verification must come from official company statements, regulatory disclosures, or reports by at least two trustworthy news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The job cuts must be directly connected to the AI-centered reorganization plan introduced in 2023.

Then, can it be said that Uber will eliminate at least 1,800 positions by July 31, 2024, as part of its restructuring plan focused on artificial intelligence? Confirmation must come from official statements from the company, regulatory filings, or reports by a minimum of two reliable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be directly associated with the AI-driven restructuring initiative announced in 2023.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If no such increase is reported during this period, this part of the question will resolve as NO. (b) Uber has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Uber confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, this part of the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution. If both (a) and (b) occur, the question will resolve as YES; otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will France appoint a new President by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purpose of this question, a 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. If no new President is appointed by the resolution date, or if the current President as of October 1, 2023, remains in office, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on France appointing a new President by August 2024, will the Bank of England's base rate remain at or above 5.00% in August 2024?
question.body:
This question examines the potential correlation between political changes in France and monetary policy in the UK. 

Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purpose of this question, a 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. 

Then, is it true that the Bank of England's base rate will remain at or above 5.00% in August 2024? This will resolve as YES if the Bank of England's base rate is reported to be at or above 5.00% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 5.00% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

If the condition about France appointing a new President is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Satya Nadella on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Satya Nadella on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Satya Nadella must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Mexican economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If no such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Tostitos brand by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Tostitos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Tostitos in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of Australia announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of Australia officially announces a decrease in its cash rate target by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of Australia or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Reserve Bank Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBA members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is the Reserve Bank of Australia expected to declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Reserve Bank of Australia publicly declares a reduction in its cash rate target by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be validated through official communications from the Reserve Bank of Australia or reported by at least two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be a formal resolution made by the Reserve Bank Board and conveyed in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any conjecture regarding prospective rate cuts or unofficial remarks by individual RBA members will not be sufficient for resolution. If no such official declaration of an interest rate reduction is made by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as negative.

question.body:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Alibaba Group workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will YouTube face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, YouTube becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If no such new actions are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to cut the NASA budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget cut is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions of budget cuts do not count; the bill must be officially passed by the Senate.

question.title: Given the Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by August 2024, will the German economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the condition is not met.

Then, is it true that the German economy will avoid a recession by July 31, 2024? For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The outcome resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the German economy does not enter a recession. It resolves as NO if the German economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. question.title: Given Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024, will the Canadian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, as verified by official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal), by July 31, 2024. Then, will the Canadian economy avoid a recession by July 31, 2024?

Resolution criteria for Mercedes-Benz's net income increase: The question resolves as YES if such an increase is reported and verified by the resolution date. It resolves as NO if no such increase is reported or if the highest increase is 20% or less.

Resolution criteria for the Canadian economy avoiding a recession: The question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Canadian economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. It resolves as NO if the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee officially announces a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be a recall of Sara Lee's packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak before the end of August 2024?

2. A press announcement from Sara Lee
3. A statement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically referring to a recall by Sara Lee
4. Articles from a minimum of three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) that cite official sources

The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the withdrawal of the products. If no recall that meets these conditions is declared by the given date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

para_P.body:

2. A press release issued by Sara Lee
3. A notification from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that specifically refers to a Sara Lee recall

question.title: Will an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members be established by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

question.title: Will the Australian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Australian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Australia steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by the end of July 2024, the Australian economy has not fallen into a recession. For this question, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as indicated by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The response will be NO if the Australian economy undergoes two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Australia steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by the end of July 2024, the Australian economy has not slipped into a recession. A recession is characterized, for this question, as two back-to-back quarters of declining GDP as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. Conversely, the answer will be NO if the Australian economy encounters two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.

3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Brazil's Bovespa index reach or exceed 130,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points. The 130,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). question.title: Conditional on Takeda allowing generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024, will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Takeda officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers).

Given this, will the WHO declare, by August 31, 2024, that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency? For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

If the condition about Takeda is not met, the resolution is N/A.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Reserve Bank of India will declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if the Reserve Bank of India makes an official declaration regarding a reduction in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be verified through official communications from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by a minimum of two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be a sanctioned decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any conjecture regarding potential rate cuts or unofficial remarks by individual RBI members will not be considered for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate reduction occurs by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as negative.

question.title: Given the Reserve Bank of India announces an interest rate cut by July 2024, will the Central Bank of Singapore announce a new exchange rate policy by August 2024?

This announcement is confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut is a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting.

Then, will the Central Bank of Singapore officially announce a new exchange rate policy by August 31, 2024? The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Singapore communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore, and it must explicitly describe the new exchange rate policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Singapore maintains the current exchange rate policy, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will LG Electronics resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if LG Electronics reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of LG Electronics workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both LG Electronics and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season does not meet these criteria, or if insufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will happen: (a) Russia will declare a successful winter harvest for wheat and barley by August 2024, and (b) Russia will reveal intentions to construct additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
para_P.body:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Russia announces a successful winter harvest for wheat and barley, defined by yields that meet or exceed the average of the last five years. This success must be validated by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). In this context, 'successful' means that the total output of wheat and barley is at least 5% higher than the five-year average. If the winter harvest does not fulfill these requirements, or if there is inadequate data to reach a conclusion, this segment resolves as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Russian government officially discloses plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the two currently in the pipeline. This declaration must originate from an official government entity, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and be reported by at least two prominent international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must explicitly express an intention to develop more reactors beyond the two already proposed, rather than merely expanding or modifying the existing plans. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the announcement merely reaffirms or updates the current two-reactor plan, this segment resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Russian government officially announces intentions to construct additional nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. question.title: Conditional on Pennsylvania receiving over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024, will Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?

question.title: Will Google lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Google has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Google confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will the Shanghai Composite index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Shanghai Composite index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Shanghai Stock Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

question.title: Given 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' is the highest-grossing R-rated movie by August 2024, will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?

The ranking is based on total box office earnings reported by at least two reputable sources such as Box Office Mojo, Variety, or The Hollywood Reporter. Then, will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 31, 2024? For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. It resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Given Universal Studios Hollywood workers approve a new labor agreement by July 2024, will the Central Bank of the Philippines announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the workers at Universal Studios Hollywood, represented by the unions involved in recent negotiations, approve a new labor agreement with Universal. This approval must be confirmed by official union announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers. The agreement must be related to the negotiations mentioned in recent news about avoiding a potential strike. 

Then, will the Central Bank of the Philippines officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024? This announcement must be confirmed by official Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas communications, such as press releases, Monetary Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the overnight reverse repurchase rate, which is the Central Bank of the Philippines' primary tool for monetary policy.

Consider this situation: By July 31, 2024, the workforce at Universal Studios Hollywood, represented by the unions involved in recent negotiations, approves a new labor agreement with Universal. This approval must be confirmed by official announcements from the union or reports from at least two reputable news organizations such as Associated Press, Reuters, or leading national newspapers. The agreement must relate to the negotiations highlighted in recent news aimed at averting a potential strike. 

In this scenario, will the Central Bank of the Philippines issue an official statement regarding a reduction in interest rates to be effective by August 31, 2024? This statement must be backed by official communications from Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas, including press releases, Monetary Board announcements, or public addresses by Bank officials. It is crucial to understand that the actual date for the implementation of the rate cut may be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the overnight reverse repurchase rate, which serves as the primary monetary policy tool for the Central Bank of the Philippines.

question.title: Will New York conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New York.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mercedes-Benz is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives. The confirmation must come from official government announcements, Mercedes-Benz's official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on abortion rights. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address abortion rights, either proposing to enshrine protections or to restrict/ban abortion. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on abortion does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Kansas state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Zoom has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in New York City by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in New York City, New York. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce a new monetary easing policy by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces a new monetary easing policy. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Indonesia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia. The announcement should explicitly describe the new monetary easing policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Indonesia maintains the current policy stance, the question resolves as NO.

The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the Spanish authorities officially declare or enact a policy to entirely abolish export tariffs on agricultural goods. The policy must be validated by official government announcements or reported by at least two credible international news agencies (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Merely reducing export tariffs or eliminating tariffs on select agricultural goods will not suffice for an affirmative outcome. If no such policy is enacted or introduced by the deadline, or if only partial actions are taken, the inquiry will be resolved as negative.

question.title: Given Spain eliminates export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024, will the United States report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024?

The policy must involve a complete elimination, not partial reductions or selective eliminations. Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, the United States will officially report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, with yields significantly above the average, at least 10% higher than the previous five-year average, confirmed by the USDA or at least three reputable news outlets? question.title: Will TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention TikTok's AI and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.0% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 5.0% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 5.0% will not be considered as falling below 5.0%.

Assume the following holds true: By July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state, excluding Georgia, officially implements a Medicaid program that incorporates a mental health support stipulation for beneficiaries. This mental health support stipulation must be a fundamental aspect of the program, with an official declaration from the state government or consistent coverage by credible national news outlets. The program must be officially in place, not just proposed or under discussion.

Then, is it accurate to say that by August 31, 2024, Tennessee will hold a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state? For a YES outcome, the vote must be officially declared and conducted by the state of Tennessee, primarily centered on the protection of abortion rights, and the results must be publicly disclosed by official state channels or well-regarded news organizations. If no such vote that meets these requirements occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will be answered as NO.

The mental health support requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). question.title: Will Iowa's 6-week abortion ban be overturned by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Iowa's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy is either repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling. The repeal or invalidation must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the law remains in effect as of July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'overturned' means the law is no longer enforceable in its current form, either through legislative action or judicial decision.

The revocation or annulment must be verified by official state communications or reported by a minimum of two credible news outlets. Should the law still be in force as of July 31, 2024, the answer will be NO. In this context, 'nullified' refers to the law being no longer applicable in its current state, either through legislative measures or court decisions.

question.title: Will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on Nigeria's Senate passing a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024, will Bayer allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, and it must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

Given this condition, will Bayer allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 31, 2024? This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Bayer continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

If the condition regarding Nigeria's Senate is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Bayer continues to enforce its patent rights, this condition is not satisfied.

para_P.title: Is it anticipated that both of the following occurrences will take place: (a) Nigeria's Senate will pass a major economic reform bill that faces opposition from President Tinubu by August 2024, and (b) Bayer will allow the creation of a generic version of its heart medication by July 2024?

   3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two significant international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news organizations in terms of its likely impact on the Nigerian economy.
   If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but fails to meet all the above criteria, this condition is not fulfilled.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow the generic production of its cardiovascular medication, effectively not enforcing its patent. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Bayer continues to enforce its patent rights, this condition is not fulfilled.

The question is answered as NO if either of the above conditions is not satisfied.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

Any conjecture regarding future rate reductions or unofficial comments from individual RBI members will not be taken into account for resolution. question.title: Will Virginia maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

This question examines whether Land O'Frost will issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 31, 2024, conditional on the World Health Organization (WHO) declaring the current West Nile virus outbreak over by the same date.

Condition: The WHO must officially declare the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC).

Outcome: The question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?

The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Indian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation of India. The question resolves as NO if the Indian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian economy has not fallen into a recession. For the context of this inquiry, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as indicated by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation of India. The response will be NO if the Indian economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Swiss National Bank or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the UK economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?

For the context of this question, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. Conversely, the answer will be NO if the UK economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on the UK economy avoiding a recession by July 2024, will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its beverage products by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession, meaning it does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. Given this condition, will PepsiCo report an increase in North American demand for its beverage products by July 31, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its beverage products compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for its beverage products in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage exceed 7.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 7.0%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 7.0% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 7.0%, not merely equal it.
